info.title: JTL-WAWI API (Cloud)
info.description:
# Introduction

Welcome to the JTL-WAWI technical API documentation. This guide is here to help developers understand how our REST API works and how it can be integrated into your existing systems. We'll delve into the details of authentication and data manipulation processes, providing clear examples along the way. Whether you're a developer or an IT professional, this documentation aims to give you a practical understanding, laying the groundwork for effectively using the JTL-WAWI API to enhance your processes.

# Authentication

You register your application with the API by sending a POST request with the required information and corresponding keys. You can find the exact request details at https://developer.jtl-software.com/products/erp/swagger/appregistration. This information has to include the following:

* AppId
* DisplayName
* Description
* Version
* ProviderName
* ProviderWebsite
* MandatoryApiScopes

This data is crucial for identifying and registering your application with the API. The API uses it to generate a temporary authentication ID that allows your application to access the necessary resources. After successful validation of this information, you will receive the API key required for future authentication and API requests.

Before you can begin the registration process, you must open JTL-Wawi (new interface) and start the registration process under 'Admin->App registration'. Only at this point are you authorised to send the first API call. This step in JTL-Wawi ensures that your application is properly registered and has permission to use the API.

The API will send you an authentication ID in the form of a token. Once you have received this token and successfully completed the registration in JTL-Wawi, you will send another request to the API by including this authentication ID in the URL path.

After successful validation of this second request by the API and confirmation of the correct information, you will be provided with the actual API key. It is important to note that this API key will not be displayed again!

This API key will be used in the future to authenticate requests to the API. It is of utmost importance that you securely store the API key upon receipt, as it cannot be retrieved from any other location in the system.

get.description: Delivers a paginated overview of finalized accounting transactions, including invoices, credits, and their cancellations and corrections.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Filters documents starting from a specific date and time

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Filters documents up to a specific date and time

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Filters documents by a specific company ID

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of document. 0 = Invoice, 1 = Credit, 2 = Invoice correction, 3 = Invoice cancellation, 4 = credit cancellation, 5 = invoice correction cancellation0=Invoice | 1=Credit | 2=InvoiceCorrection | 3=InvoiceCancellation | 4=CreditCancellation | 5=InvoiceCorrectionCancellation | 6=Liquidation | 7=LiquidationCancellation

parameters.name: exportCurrencyInDepartureCountry
parameters.description: If true, exports total sums in the currency of the departure country

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Number of the page of items to fetch.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Size of the page that is specified by `pageNumber`.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The requested API version

parameters.name: x-appid
parameters.description: This is the name of your application, in this case "MyApp/1.0.0". It is used to identify your application.

parameters.name: x-appversion
parameters.description: This is where the version number of your application is entered, in this case "1.0.0".

parameters.name: x-runas
parameters.description: The User-Id as int or uuid to run the Request, a JTL-Wawi user can be specified to perform an API call on their behalf (more details in the documentation, Optional). To use the Header, you must have the needed Scope 'Application.RunAs'

parameters.name: tenant-id
parameters.description: Specify the TenantId in GUID Format

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Specify the ApiKey from RegistrationProcess in Uuid Format

200.description: Provides a detailed overview of all non-pending sales orders, including invoices, credits, invoice corrections, invoice cancellations, credit cancellations, and invoice correction cancellations, along with their associated line items

402.description: No licence available or the app has not been authorised by JTL.

404.description: No registration request was found for the specified identifier

post.description: Send a registration request for an (external) application

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The requested API version

parameters.name: x-challengecode
parameters.description: You can enter any custom value here. The X-ChallengeCode is used during app registration and must be the same for all registration requests. The maximum length is 30 characters.

parameters.name: tenant-id
parameters.description: Specify the TenantId in GUID Format

201.description: Status of the registration process (including the unique identifiers for application and registration request)

402.description: No licence available or the app has not been authorised by JTL.

403.description: There was no application service available to receive and handle the registration request

409.description: An application with the specified unique id is already registered.

Type.description: Type of the sales invoice item.0=CustomLineItem | 1=Item | 2=Shipping | 3=Coupon | 4=Voucher | 5=Payment | 6=ShippingSurcharge | 7=NewCustomerCoupon | 8=CashOnDelivery | 9=ShippingSurchargeItem | 10=GiftWrapping | 11=GiftForFree | 12=TrustedShops | 13=InterestPremium | 14=ProcessingFee | 15=Carton | 16=ReturnDelivery | 17=MultiPurposeVoucher | 18=MultiPurposeVoucherDigital | 19=SinglePurposeVoucher | 20=SinglePurposeVoucherDigital | 21=SinglePurposeVoucherRedemption

Quantity.description: The quantity of the line item.

SalesUnit.description: The measurement unit in which the line item is sold.

SalesPriceNet.description: The net sales price of the line item.

SalesPriceGross.description: The gross sales price of the line item.

Discount.description: The discount applied to the line item.

PurchasePriceNet.description: The price for which the merchant has bought the item.

TaxRate.description: The tax rate of the line item.

TotalItems.description: Gets or sets the total number of items available in the data source.

PageNumber.description: Gets or sets the current page number in the paginated list.

PageSize.description: Gets or sets the number of items per page in the paginated list.

Items.description: Gets or sets the collection of items contained in the paged list.

TotalPages.description: Gets the total number of pages based on the total number of items and the page size.

HasPreviousPage.description: Gets a value indicating whether there is a previous page available in the paginated list.

HasNextPage.description: Gets a value indicating whether there is a next page available.

NextPageNumber.description: Gets the number of the next page if there is one; otherwise, returns the total number of pages.

PreviousPageNumber.description: Gets the number of the previous page. If there is no previous page, it returns 1.

PagedListOfInvoice.description: Represents a paginated list of items

Asins.description: A list of the item's ASINs.

OwnIdentifier.description: A custom identifier for the item.

SalesPriceNet.description: The net sales price of the item.

SuggestedRetailPrice.description: The suggested retail price for the item.

PurchasePriceNet.description: The purchase price of the item.

EbayPrice.description: Default price in new listing templates.

AmazonPrice.description: Brutto price for new Amazon listings.

InventoryManagementActive.description: Indicates if inventory management for the item is active, meaning that the item displays stock quantities.

SplitQuantity.description: Indicates if the item can be split into quantities less than 1.

GlobalMinimumStockLevel.description: Defines the minimum quantity that should always be in stock. For example, when calculating purchasing orders.

Buffer.description: The buffer of the item. Used when selling time-delayed across different sales channels, so as not to sell more than is in stock.

SerialNumberItem.description: Indicates the item's serial number when shipping the sales orders.

SerialNumberTracking.description: Indicates if serial numbers are to be identified during a goods receipt process from a supplier.

SubjectToShelfLifeExpirationDate.description: Indicates if the item has an expiration date, also known as a best before date.

SubjectToBatchItem.description: Indicates whether the item is a batch item or not.

ProcurementTime.description: The procurement time indicates how many days it will take for the goods to be ready for shipment if they are currently out of stock. Procurement time is determined automatically on the basis of the suppliers delivery time. By default, the delivery time of the default supplier is used as the procurement time. If additional processing time (in days) has been specified, this is added to the procurement time.

DetermineProcurementTimeAutomatically.description: If this option is set, the procurement time will be calculated from the default supplier's shipment time.

AdditionalHandlingTime.description: Indicates the additional processing time in days required to process. It is always added to the delivery time.

ItemWeigth.description: The weight of the item in kilograms.

ShippingWeight.description: The shipping weight of the item in kilograms.

MinimumOrderQuantity.description: The minimum order quantity of the item.

MinimumPurchaseQuantityForCustomerGroup.description: A collection of minimum order quantities for different customer groups.

PermissibleOrderQuantity.description: The permissible order quantity for the item. Indicates the increments in which the item is sold.

UnNumber.description: The UN number for the item.

HazardNo.description: The hazard number for the item.

FromQuantity.description: The quantity where this scale price starts. This scale price ends at the next highest quantity. If there is no scale price with a higher quantity, then this price is set for all quantities from this point on.

PurchasePriceNet.description: Net purchase price of the supplier for the scale price starting from this given quantity to the next scale price with a higher quantity. If you use PurchasePriceNet, you can't use ReduceStandardSpBy% as well. Only one is allowed.

ReduceStandardPriceByPercent.description: Reduces the default purchase price by a percentage. If you use PurchasePriceNet, you can't use ReduceStandardPriceByPercent as well. Only one is allowed.

MergeStockLevel.description: Forces Wawi to add the supplier's stock to your own stock.

Id.description: Id of the pick list position.

StorageLocationId.description: Id of the storage location from where the pick should happen.

ItemId.description: Id of the item.

SalesOrderLineItemId.description: Id of the corresponding order position.

CreatedAt.description: Time when the pick list was created.

TotalItems.description: Gets or sets the total number of items available in the data source.

PageNumber.description: Gets or sets the current page number in the paginated list.

PageSize.description: Gets or sets the number of items per page in the paginated list.

Items.description: Gets or sets the collection of items contained in the paged list.

TotalPages.description: Gets the total number of pages based on the total number of items and the page size.

HasPreviousPage.description: Gets a value indicating whether there is a previous page available in the paginated list.

HasNextPage.description: Gets a value indicating whether there is a next page available.

NextPageNumber.description: Gets the number of the next page if there is one; otherwise, returns the total number of pages.

PreviousPageNumber.description: Gets the number of the previous page. If there is no previous page, it returns 1.

PagedListOfPickListTemplate.description: Represents a paginated list of items
